about.content: <par>Biomedical Engineering student at the University of Texas at Dallas with a passion for innovative medical devices and engineering solutions that improve healthcare. My journey combines technical experience with creative problem-solving, aiming to address real-world challenges in biomedical systems.</par> <par>Through research internships and Co-Op experiences, I have developed skills in SolidWorks design, 3D printing, and rapid-prototyping. I am committed to creating solutions that merge cutting-edge technology with practical applications.</par> <par> I am enthusiastic about contributing my skills and knowledge to projects that can drive meaningful change in the healthcare industry and beyond.</par>

experience.diving_bear_description: Contributed to the design and development of innovative components for FDA-regulated medical devices.
diving_bear_description_list: Sample Container Holder Project: Designed a durable, reusable sample holder using SolidWorks and 3D printing, improving laboratory workflow
Scope Buddy Project: Developed and tested a new O-ring for improved sealing and water flow in the Scope Buddy 1700, collaborating with engineers to refine the design.
Syringe Recall Project: Supported FDA compliance by validating syringe replacements, updating part numbers, and revising Instructions for the Use (IFUs).
Clamshell Project: Prototyped a clamshell for LED valve curing, addressing misalignment issues and ensuring compatibility with existing systems.
experience.phd_company: The University of Texas at Dallas
experience.phd_description: Developed an innovative sensing platform for monitoring soil health and stability
phd_description_list: Designed and calibrated an ion-selective electrode for ammonium detection in soil samples.
Collected and analyzed data to evaluate soil stability and nutrient imbalances.
Collaborated with a PhD student to co-author a publication for the American Chemical Society.
Demonstrated the platform's in-situ monitoring capabilities to stakeholders.
experience.Clark_description: Designed a werable biosensor for monitoring cortisol and glucose spikes.
Clark_description_list: Created and tested a werable biosensor for sweat dispersion analysis.
Conducted research and presented findings at a summer undergraduate research symposium (SPUR).
Earned an award for technical expertise and presentation skills.
Developed 3D models for the device patch and fabricated prototypes.
experience.WIP_description: Led the design of a wearable device for monitoring glucose in infants with diabetes.
WIP_description_list: Developed a lightweight wristband using near-infrared spectroscopy for non-invasive glucose monitoring.
Created a 3D model in SolidWorks and fabricated prototypes using 3D printing.
Validated functionality through home-based testing with simulated glucose solutiosn.
Integrated an NIR sensor with Arduino Nano for affordable and efficient glucose detection.

education.ens_institution: The University of Texas at Dallas
education.ipgp_description: I specialized in seismology and geodynamics, and learned to model the Earth's interior and study its dynamics.

items.name: Certified SolidWorks Professional - Advanced Drawing Tools
Certified SolidWorks Professional - Advanced Sheet Metal
